alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A stationary thunderstorm will impact portions of central Limestone County through 745 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a nearly stationary thunderstorm over Tanner. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rainfall of one to two inches of rainfall has already fallen producing ponding on area roadways. Another half to one inch of rainfall is possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens and Tanner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
